decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence of Human creatures, leveraging their synergy and aggressive capabilities to overwhelm the opponent. This is achieved by playing disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter, buffing the team with Thalia's Lieutenant, and using Aether Vial for efficient creature deployment. The mix of heavy hitters like Mantis Rider and Champion of the Parish with disruptive elements creates a fast-paced and powerful aggro strategy that aims to win the game before the opponent can fully establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By combining efficient creatures like Matter Reshaper and Reality Smasher with powerful utility spells like Lightning Bolt and Ancient Stirrings, it aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Eldrazi Obligator and Bloodbraid Elf provides additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain tempo. With a solid mana base and key support cards like Noble Hierarch, this deck is designed to consistently apply pressure and win games quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing a fast and aggressive strategy with a focus on Human creatures. By maximizing the synergy between Human creatures and tribal support cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly. Cards like Aether Vial and Reflector Mage provide additional tempo advantages, while disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben can disrupt opponents' game plans. The deck aims to maintain pressure and disrupt opponents' strategies to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with aggressive human creatures, utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump up the team. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. The deck's mana base is optimized for human tribal synergy, ensuring that the creatures can be cast efficiently and consistently. Overall, the key concept is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and disruptive aggro strategy centered around powerful human creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cycle through your creatures using cards like Street Wraith and Monstrous Carabid, while also disrupting your opponent's board with cards like Fulminator Mage and Beast Within. The goal is to fill your graveyard with creatures and then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield, overwhelming your opponent with a massive army. The deck also includes combo pieces like Demonic Dread and Violent Outburst to help you cascade into your game-winning Living End. With efficient card cycling and powerful creatures, this deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this Hollow One deck is to quickly and aggressively play powerful creatures like Hollow One, Gurmag Angler, Flamewake Phoenix, and Flameblade Adept using discard spells like Goblin Lore and Burning Inquiry to fill the graveyard with cards and enable their abilities. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and synergistic aggro strategy, utilizing cards like Bloodghast and Street Wraith for additional value. The inclusion of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality help to control the board and protect the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressively getting powerful creatures like Gurmag Angler, Flamewake Phoenix, and Hollow One onto the battlefield quickly by using cards like Goblin Lore and Burning Inquiry to discard cards and enable their effects. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient threats while also utilizing graveyard recursion with cards like Bloodghast to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck's main strategy is to be proactive and apply early pressure to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards through effects like Goblin Lore and Burning Inquiry in order to cheat out powerful creatures like Hollow One, Gurmag Angler, and Flamewake Phoenix. By utilizing cards that allow for fast-paced cycling and graveyard interactions, this aggressive deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a relentless assault of threats. The key strategy is to efficiently utilize the graveyard as a resource to consistently put pressure on the opponent and maintain board presence.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan. By taking advantage of bounce lands and additional land drops, the deck aims to assemble the powerful Amulet Titan combo as quickly as possible. With access to powerful lands and utility creatures, the deck can generate overwhelming board presence and combo off to secure victory. The strategy revolves around combining lands, creatures, and spells in perfect harmony to overwhelm opponents and win the game in a swift and decisive manner.

This deck aims to quickly discard cards and put powerful creatures like Hollow One and Flamewake Phoenix onto the battlefield early in the game. By utilizing cards like Goblin Lore, Burning Inquiry, and Faithless Looting, the deck can quickly fill up the graveyard and cast these creatures for free or at a reduced cost. This aggressive strategy allows the deck to apply constant pressure on the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, cards like Bloodghast and Gurmag Angler provide additional threats to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively with a mix of disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter, alongside efficient removal in Path to Exile. It also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and generate value. Restoration Angel and Flickerwisp provide additional utility by blinking creatures for extra value. The deck can also generate incremental advantage with Gavony Township and Horizon Canopy. Overall, the strategy revolves around disrupting opponents' game plans while applying pressure with efficient creatures to secure the win.

The main concept of this deck is to control the opponent's draws and prevent them from playing their cards effectively. This is accomplished through cards such as Lantern of Insight, Codex Shredder, and Whir of Invention. The deck also includes cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Witchbane Orb to protect the player from creature attacks and targeted spells. Additionally, there are disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Abrupt Decay to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck has a strong artifact theme, utilizing Mox Opal and various artifact lands to generate mana efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf. Utilizing efficient removal spells and disruptive hand disruption, the deck aims to control the board while pushing for a fast win through aggressive threats. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Traverse the Ulvenwald helps to ensure consistency and card advantage, while versatile cards like Abrupt Decay and Stubborn Denial provide additional answers to opposing strategies. The goal is to apply constant pressure and force opponents to react to the threat of lethal damage from Death's Shadow.

This deck aims to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards to allow for explosive plays and strong board presence. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry, the deck can quickly put Hollow One and other powerful creatures onto the battlefield for little to no cost. This focuses on aggression and utilizing the graveyard as a resource, overwhelming opponents with quick and powerful creatures. The mix of direct damage spells and aggressive creatures makes for a fast and potent strategy that can catch opponents off guard and quickly finish the game.

The key concept of this Control - UrzaTron deck is to assemble the Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Mine (UrzaTron) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is then used to cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to control the board and eventually win the game. The deck also includes various ways to search for and protect the UrzaTron lands, as well as disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Relic of Progenitus and Oblivion Stone.

This deck focuses on quickly casting low-cost creatures like Hollow One, Bloodghast, and Gurmag Angler to apply early pressure on your opponent. The key strategy involves utilizing cards like Faithless Looting, Burning Inquiry, and Goblin Lore to discard cards and gain value from creatures like Flamewake Phoenix. The deck also benefits from utilizing Tasigur, the Golden Fang for card advantage and removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality to control the board. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient plays.
